terrapeer.vui.j3dui.feedback
Class FeedbackManager

java.lang.Object
  terrapeer.vui.j3dui.feedback.FeedbackManager
Direct Known Subclasses:
ActionManager, SelectManager, StatusManager
public abstract class FeedbackManager
extends java.lang.Object

An abstract base class for managers that manage feedback interaction for a group of targets through feedback triggers. The manager and its minions are assumed to be of the same feedback type (status, select, action). After all targets have been attached use initTargets() to initialize the feedback targets. During input event processing all input events are blocked to avoid loops.

Target interaction is monitored directly on the multishape targets, which means that interaction can originate from any source, even a different manager. The state of the trigger is not intended to be manipulated directly. It is intended to be a true indication of user input relative to the target.

To add a target use getTargetTrigger() to see if a trigger already exists. If not, use addTarget() to add a multishape target for management. The returned feedback trigger must be supplied with event sources such that it monitors the target for user interaction.

Constructor Detail

FeedbackManager

protected FeedbackManager(int type)
Constructs a FeedbackManager of the specified event type. Use addTarget() to add feedback targets for management.

Parameters:
type - Type of feedback event handled by the minion (FeedbackMinion.Feedback.TYPE_???).
Method Detail

addTarget

public FeedbackTrigger addTarget(MultiShape target)
Adds a new target for feedback management through a minion. The returned trigger must be configured with event sources to monitor the target for user interaction. If the target is already being managed then a new trigger should not be added otherwise race conditions can occur. Use getTargetTrigger() to check for an existing trigger before adding a new target.

For action managers the returned action trigger is constructed with the feedback target as the single mouse-over pick target. If a different pick target is required use the trigger's setPickTargets().

Parameters:
target - The feedback target to be managed. Never null.
Returns:
Feedback trigger constructed by the managed minion. Never null.

getTargetTrigger

public FeedbackTrigger getTargetTrigger(MultiShape target)
Gets the (first) trigger that is managing the specified target. If the target is not being managed returns null.

Parameters:
target - The target being managed. If null ignored.
Returns:
Existing trigger managing the target. Null if none or if the target is not being managed.

getGroup

public java.util.AbstractList getGroup(int targetFlags,
                                       int triggerFlags,
                                       java.util.AbstractList copy)
Gets a list of references to minions that satisfy the specified target and trigger state flags. At least one flag must be satisfied in a minion's target and trigger to be included in the group.

Parameters:
targetFlags - Target state flags of the same event type as this manager. Use Feedback.???_ALL for "don't care".
triggerFlags - Trigger state flags of the same event type as this manager. Use Feedback.???_ALL for "don't care".
copy - Container for the copied return list, containing FeedbackMinion objects.
Returns:
Reference to copy.

getType

public int getType()
Gets this manager's feedback type, which is also that of its minions.

Returns:
Manager feedback type (Feedback.TYPE_???).

initTargets

public void initTargets(MultiShape target,
                        int state)
Initializes the managed targets. If the specified target is null all targets are initialized to the specified state. If not null only the specified target is set.

Parameters:
target - The target to be initialized. Null if none. Ignored if not a target.
state - Initial feedback state. Assumed to be of the correct feedback type for the managed minion (STATUS_???, SELECT_???, ACTION_???).

getTargetAnySource

public FeedbackSplitter getTargetAnySource()
Gets the collateral target "target any" event source, which is notified when the feedback state changes on any managed target (whether due to external target feedback or internal trigger feedback).

Returns:
Reference to the splitter.

getTriggerAnySource

public FeedbackSplitter getTriggerAnySource()
Gets the collateral target "trigger any" event source, which is notified when the feedback state changes on any managed trigger.

Returns:
Reference to the splitter.

getMinions

protected java.util.ArrayList getMinions()
Gets the feedback minion list.

Returns:
Reference to the list of FeedbackMinion.

manageMinion

protected void manageMinion(FeedbackMinion minion,
                            int state,
                            boolean isTarget)
Calls manageFeedback() and then performs collateral target notification. Called when a feedback event occurs on any managed minion.

Parameters:
minion - Minion whose state changed. Never null.
state - New feedback state of the same event type as the minion.
isTarget - True if the event originated from a target. False if it originated from a trigger (i.e. user input).

manageFeedback

protected abstract void manageFeedback(FeedbackMinion minion,
                                       int state,
                                       boolean isTarget)
Override this method to perform feedback management including relaying trigger events to the target. Called when a feedback event occurs on any managed target or trigger.

Parameters:
minion - Minion whose state changed. Never null.
state - New feedback state of the same event type as the minion.
isTarget - True if the event originated from a target. False if it originated from a trigger (i.e. user input).
